duties_responsibilities.duty: Assess physical and psychosocial needs of patients and plan individual care of patient.
Coordinate resources for complete and effective patient care.
Possess effective communication, interpersonal and teamwork skills.
Utilize medical equipment properly and operate and monitor medical life-support equipment and systems.
Keep records of vital signs, significant conditions, and reactions and monitor and assess patient.
Provide education to patient and/or significant other and communicate appropriate information on the patient’s condition.
Participate in professional growth and personal development and follow patient care standards.
Provide immediate treatment and call for the initiation of emergency procedures upon recognizing danger signals.

education_certification.credential: Associate's Degree in Nursing from NLN, CCNE or equivalent accredited school of nursing.
Current California RN license - Upon hire
Pediatric Advanced Life Support - Within 3 months of hire into job
Oncology Nursing Society (ONS) Bio-Chemo - Within 6 months of hire into job
